website_summaries.verdict: Don't let the smaller size or few quirks stop you from considering this griddle - it's well made and comes in a practical style with a value price.
pros: An affordable model by a top name in cast iron griddles that offers similar user-friendly features as pricier options - pre-seasoning and reversible cook surfaces
cons: Edge "walls" aren't wide enough to prevent oil from spilling off the sides
A few reports of uneven griddles that seemed warped

customer_reviews.title: Love this grill pan
customer_reviews.text: I'm a huge cast iron fan and this was a great addition. I read several reviews complaining about food sticking, or the pan being difficult to wash. It's cast iron, you need to make sure it's well oiled and hot enough, otherwise food will stick. A stiff brush (but never steel wool) works great for cleaning, and cast iron gets better (easier to clean, more non-stick) with use. Shipped quickly (by quickly I mean I ordered it around 6pm and it was on my porch at 9am) and was packaged well.
customer_reviews.author: Kristine Bella Noel

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Of course the first thing we cooked ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Of course the first thing we cooked on it was bacon too! Tastes way different than cooking it in a Teflon pan, and way better imo. Haven't had a problem with sticking, but I also know how to break in and cook on cast iron. If you haven't used cast iron, or haven't had to break a new surface in, do a bit of research first. Even the preseasoned stuff needs a bit of tlc before it's ready to go!
customer_reviews.author: A Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe product
customer_reviews.text: Sorry.. the specifications were perfect for my cooktop size but it cracked up with a loud noise. It is not a safe product.
customer_reviews.author: SRK

customer_reviews.title: Side height way too low on Lodge LDP3 Reversible Grill/Griddle
customer_reviews.text: For practical use, the side edges of the Lodge LDP3 Reversible Grill/Griddle are simply too low. Unless you are incredibly careful, it's extremely likely food, oil, etc will splash or slide over the sides during use. Just a heads up, some people may be unusually careful or would not mind spillage, clean up, etc.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gaowei

customer_reviews.title: Rusts very easily!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a few months ago and have not yet used it for its purpose. But, yesterday I had a nearby pot boil over and a little bit of water splashed onto the griddle. It was a small amount of water. I figured it would dry quickly. Within an hour the griddle was rusting! I wonder what would have happened if I used it for its purpose and than washed it? The grooves don’t make it easy to 100% dry it, nor should It rust! Glad I didn’t cook food on this. Now it’s too late to even return. Waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Erin P.

customer_reviews.title: Love this grill
customer_reviews.text: Love this grill. I'm a big fan of cast iron and wanted to try the grill. Love the ridged side for grill mark on steaks and burgers.. My husband likes the flat side for his sandwiches. It's pretty heavy but I'm careful when using it on my glass cooktop. It has a bridge burner and this grill firs it perfectly. Love that it was pre-seasoned. I did rub it with a little oil and put it into the oven at 500 degrees for about 20 minutes. Worked great. Next, we'll try it on our outdoor gas grill. So much easier to deal with than the racks on that. Love Lodge products and love that they're made in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: L. Blair

customer_reviews.title: BOO, Lodge Products!
customer_reviews.text: I used to purchase Lodge products, including this griddle, but was sorrily disappointed even after following the instructions diligently to coat the surface between cooking in order to prevent rust and sticking. I cleaned the surface exactly as directed and low and behold it still developed so much rust and the food stuck on it that it is rendered unusable. I upgraded to LeCruset Enameled Cast Iron and I know it is super expensive, but I have never had food stick to it or had a single speck of rust after multiple years of cooking on it daily.
customer_reviews.author: FelineFriendly

customer_reviews.title: Perhaps I made a mistake
customer_reviews.text: I seasoned the griddle per the instructions and added even a bit more oil, but the griddle was difficult to have the non-stickiness I was hoping for. Most of what I cooked on there left residue. I don't blame the griddle because the error could be on my end. It asked for vegetable oil, which we don't have in our house. I used Olive Oil instead, so who knows if that is the issue. The griddle is certainly heavy duty and my hope is that through future use and more seasoning I can get it back to how it is supposed to be.
customer_reviews.author: Foxy

customer_reviews.title: Stuck on items hard to remove
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this product after a demo and review on YouTube by some chef. It’s two sided which is nice and fits comfortably over my middle burners on my stove top. But, even seasoned and cleaned properly it’s hard to remove bbq sauce that has cooked on it. I’ve made pancakes on it, that, to tell the truth, are better in the pan. Gives a good sear on chicken but I’m kinda worried about cleaning it again.good value for the product itself. I’ll continue using it and give an updated review when I do.
customer_reviews.author: lori

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had purchased this years ago!
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my grill to keep things from getting too dried out during grilling. Still get the nice grill marks , but keep the flavor I lost before with the drying out of the meats. The griddle comes pre-seasoned so it's ready to use right out of the box without the hassle of getting one that needs to be seasoned and haing to oil it and then bake it to get it right. Amazon had the best price too. Buy this, you won't regret it for a second!
customer_reviews.author: Everyman

customer_reviews.title: Works really well.
customer_reviews.text: When you get it you might think it is small but it handled cooking eggs, bacon and sausage for a small group of people just fine. Here is a though as well. I almost returned this for a larger size but getting a second one was the better idea. It offered more flexibility for my camp stove and it was easier to transport. So think about how you will use this and decide if you want to go this route as well. I did season it more as I really wanted to get a better season then what it comes with. Go get some flax oil for this. Look up Cowboy Kent Rollins for seasoning tips on youtube.
customer_reviews.author: Paris B.

customer_reviews.title: First cast Iron, I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have an electric stove top and it fits right over the burners. The cast iron holds it's heat very nicely and I love that it was pre-seasoned. I can also use this camping over coals. Fantastic deal for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Kind of a letdown
customer_reviews.text: Maybe would have worked better on a gas range, but I find the size to be a bit awkward as it just barely covers two of my burners, and because it's electric one of those burners is much smaller than the other. It causes some crazy temperature differences that are difficult to work around when you require a large cooking surface, like the reason you would buy, haul out, and sacrifice having to clean a cast iron griddle. I think I would have been better off putting the money towards a good electric griddle. This will probably work well on a grill, but I haven't had an occasion to need a griddle on my grill.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: did not work as well as expected
customer_reviews.text: I placed the plate on the two burners and let it warm up for about 5-10min. I placed my items on the plate and realized it was not evenly heated. Some places were cold and other places were burning the food quickly. The food I was cooking was ultimately not worth keeping. I am not sure if just needed more warm up time or if that is just how the product is. The plate is cast iron and very dense. I do like the two different surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: S&H

customer_reviews.title: Solid but unwieldy
customer_reviews.text: Pro: 1. It is cast iron. 2. It has reversible sides that is a flat griddle and a grill. 3. I have made many steaks on it. Con: 1. It is messy. Making steak with it on stove top will have oil and fat everywhere. Maybe it would be less of an issue on top of a BBQ. 2. It is hard to clean, especially on the grill side, at the base of the ridges. I have yet figure out a easy way to do this. 3. It is hard to handle, especially when it is hot. But it is a solid piece of cast iron, so if you know how to season/clean/use cast iron, it delivers.
customer_reviews.author: WWC

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Grill
customer_reviews.text: The pre season they did isn’t great, but if you own cast iron, you’re probably used to having to season it yourself. Not too big of a deal, works great and seasoning it yourself can be done fairly quickly. Love the heat distribution and how easy it is to cook on. Have made chicken, pork chops, burgers, grilled bread, and am about to make steaks. All turned out amazing so far.
customer_reviews.author: steven ervin

customer_reviews.title: doe not heat evenly
customer_reviews.text: Cleaned thoroughly when delivered then seasoned in the oven (avocado oil at 450 degrees for an hour on both sides.). Made pancakes as a test. Used the griddle across two burners to attempt even heat. Set to medium. Found that the pancakes stuck even after lightly oiling the griddle prior to use, and half of the pancake would be alot darker than the rest across the four pancakes made. Unit marginally easy to clean, but sorta not (I have several cast iron pans and have experience with them in general). Going to have a friend bead blast the griddle then clean and re-season.
customer_reviews.author: Andre Depretis

customer_reviews.title: Keep your gas grill clean!
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my outdoor gas grill to cook hamburgers on, I bought a new gas grill this summer, I want my grill to stay clean, free of the grease dripping and food particles that usually accumulate beneath the grill grate/ bottom of grill. If the grill is level the lip on this cast iron griddle keeps the grease on the griddle and not on the bottom of the grill. I clean it in my slop sink with a scrub brush and HOT water and i then wipe it dry and then apply a light coat of olive oil. I have only used the flat side.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald n Suzie

customer_reviews.title: Best pancakes ever on gas stove
customer_reviews.text: I got this after making totally crappy pancakes in a frying pan. Now I'm making epic photo-quality pancakes thanks to this griddle. I heat it up for a few minutes before using. Heat distribution is excellent, but not 100% even between the two burners. I'm an engineer who can do heat diffusion calculations, so I know that 100% perfection is basically impossible for something of this thickness. It is perfect for what it's for. This thing is a total life changer in the pancake department. My life is better now.
customer_reviews.author: Nick T

customer_reviews.title: Once they are seasoned they are virtually non stick.
customer_reviews.text: Heat distribution on an induction cooktop leaves a bit to be desired but I don't know that this is the grills fault. I mostly have to make my pancakes right over the 2 circles on the cooktop. Tortillas brown nicely you just have to move them around a bit. Well made very heavy. Only a slight buzz when I turn the heat up on my cooktop. I would buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to clean after grilling.
customer_reviews.text: The heat distribution is very good. But the cleaning if this product is horrible. The area is messy after use. Will need to purchase a mesh to put around the area next time. Also the grill portion is horrible to clean after usage. The remnants from the meats grilled stick to the grill itself and us very difficult to clean a hundred percent. But the smooth surface on the other side us excellent to cook other food items such as pancakes, eggs etc. Just messy though and splash all over the area on top of the stove.
customer_reviews.author: Nordeen L.

customer_reviews.title: Spilling issues.
customer_reviews.text: I wish there's an easier way to handle this product once it gets hot... But it is what it is... The main issue for me is really the lip is pretty low, so if you're grilling something fatty; oil will pool up and spill; like bacon. If you're cooking eggs and you're on an uneven surface too, it will spill over.
customer_reviews.author: Kiem Dang

customer_reviews.title: The heat does not distribute evenly!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am kinda disappointed with this grill. I tried it last night and it takes a long time to heat it up. The heat was concentrated on the center of the grill only. You have to grill foods in the middle first and put them on the side. And the food got cooled fast. Plus, since it's made of iron, do not expect any non-stick feature here. After I put the salmon on it, the skin was stick on the grill even though I sprayed a lot of oil on it. Maybe I do not know how to use it correctly. But it's not user-friendly to me at least... :(
customer_reviews.author: Serena Wang

customer_reviews.title: Great grill
customer_reviews.text: Finally had a chance to use this while camping for a couple of nights. The quality is great, I just wish the flat top side had deeper side walls. For breakfast we cooked a whole package of bacon, but had to remove the griddle and precious cargo from the heat twice to drain the grease off. The scrambled eggs came out perfectly, truly non-stick out of the box. The side walls are barely 1/4" high, if they were higher this would have been 5 stars. The grill side worked great on the pork loin, steaks, and veggies we had for dinner. Provided great grill marks and didn't lose any veggies to the fire gods.
customer_reviews.author: MadMango

customer_reviews.title: Too small!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these a few years ago, and I have barely used it. Simply put, this thing is way too small to truly be useful. It needs to be about 6 inches wider, 3 inches longer, and a quarter inch deeper. As-is, it's very difficult to cook much on it, as food is constantly spilling over the sides and you're fighting for space with other things. I tried to cook a breakfast on it, and even just trying to fry four eggs on one end while my hashbrowns cooked on the other, the eggs flow and splash over the edges. EVERY single time I use this, I find myself wishing it were just a little bit larger larger.
customer_reviews.author: Frosti

customer_reviews.title: Worth the investment!
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love our grill. We use it kore than our Le Creuset Grill pan. We like to use the flat aide for pancakes or making sevral eggs in the morning. The grill side is the best for making bacon in the morning in a jiff! We've also used it outside on our grill to grill asparagus & other veggies that may fall through the regular grill...Very versatile, pnly wish we would have bought sooner! It sits on top of our stove since we use it daily!
customer_reviews.author: CALI

customer_reviews.title: Great, a little small
customer_reviews.text: We like this grill/griddle a lot. It's a great addition to our BBQ. My husband cooks great burgers on it. It's a little small for larger cooking projects, though. It would be great if it came in a slightly larger size for things like pizza. And I definitely DO NOT RECOMMEND COOKING INDOORS. There are several photos of cooking pancakes and stuff on the griddle on your indoor stove. That is a very bad idea. A seasoned cast iron griddle has oil on it...to keep it seasoned. This creates A LOT of smoke indoors. We tried cooking one thing inside and it set off our smoke detector...in the bedroom... for an hour. Save it for your BBQ projects outside.
customer_reviews.author: Ainslie Schroeder

customer_reviews.title: Kitchen Bling
customer_reviews.text: This thing is just amazing. Fits perfectly over my gas stove. Doesn’t tilt, plenty of space to cook several things at the same time. Even the bacon doesn’t spit up tons of oil like in a pan. Nothing sticks. The cleaning is super easy. I really just wanted to throw it in the dishwasher but I’m like no. I will take care of it and hand wash it. I may give it a name, something like sizzler or hot rack. It inspires me to cook more and it’s so well made. Buy it and get those patties on deck!
customer_reviews.author: BKNY1981

customer_reviews.title: Summertime Anytime 👩‍🍳
customer_reviews.text: I considered this cast iron stove top grill after watching one of my favorite cooking shows' the host was grilling a strip steak without too much fuss or mess, this answered many questions for me. I also own a smaller cast iron grill but this one allows me to cook bigger cuts of meat at one time. So if you can't wait for the warm weather to get your grilling on I would truly recommend you to look into this item, than get to doing some grilling and enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Bruno

customer_reviews.title: This is a horrible product.
customer_reviews.text: Don't know where to begin. Don't order this product. It doesn't heat evenly, everything sticks to it, it burns everything that touches it, and you can't clean it. I cook with cast iron all the time, so it isn't me. I tried everything to make this work and eventually just threw it out. You get what you pay for I guess. This is a terrible product.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty Grill
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to warm up tortillas on an induction stove top. Works GREAT!!! The reason I have given it a 3 star is that it's starting to warp causing it to raddle. Since my cook top is glass, I'm afraid it will scratch it or chip it. Might have to switch to a different solution. And, no I have not been cleaning this with cold water and hot.
customer_reviews.author: miky21

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect and what I wanted exactly. As far as the reviews of rust... yes that happens if you are not familiar with and know how to care for cast iron! You need to follow the cleaning directions. Never use soap and dry immediately after washing because air drying will cause rust. It is a perfect size to cover my two burners on my stove. And nice and heavy. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Meghan Price

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: First off, you can't beat the price for this griddle. It's a great quality and does everything that the description says it does. It's a nice heavy quality, easy to clean and comes in so handy! Especially for a quick grilled cheese sandwich, quesadillas or pancakes. We haven't grilled any burgers on it yet and will save that for winter time to try. Overall, great product!
customer_reviews.author: Sprinks&Bell

customer_reviews.title: Fantasic grill! Fits perfectly over my gas burners.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very fortunate to have a gas range in my apartment. It took a while to get used to, and I eventually replaced all my stainless-steel cookware with Lodge cast-iron. This rectangular grill replaces two other pans: a square grill pan that I hated using, and a round griddle that was never quite big enough. With a chain-mail scrubber, this pan is very easy to clean, and fits perfectly over two oven burners. It arrived in beautiful comdition: pre-seasoned and ready for use. Like all of Lodge's well made pieces, it will last for a life time at least with simple care and proper handling.
customer_reviews.author: Misanthrope

customer_reviews.title: Works wonderfully
customer_reviews.text: Used this for several days now. I’ve made a ton vegetables and some shrimp on the grill side and pancakes on the other. No issues with sticking. Even though it says presesoned, you should to break it in a little. That’s what keeps it from sticking. I can not emphasize this enough. If you have never used a cast iron, please RESEARCH about it. It’s not invincible but if you take care of it, if pays off. Tired of seeing bad reviews like ones here. Stupidity has nothing to do with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: Bit clunky and hard to maintain, but it will do the job.
customer_reviews.text: I like it, but it doesn't heat evenly on my stove and I have an extra oblong one in the middle, so my pancakes are always part brown part white. I don't use it often because it's very heavy and hard to clean. Also, it's a pain to season it and it gets my countertop greasy. It doesn't have high enough walls, so I don't make bacon on it or anything too greasy, which defeats the purpose. So if my pancakes are uneven and the bacon grease spills out, what else can I cook on it? I do like cast iron, but I think I should stick to pots and pans with sides.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Samurai

customer_reviews.title: Great Griddle
customer_reviews.text: This is a great double sided cast iron griddle that works great for camping or everyday use. We bought this for camping and used it on a 2 burner camping stove and on an RV stove without any problem. Everything cooked evenly and cleanup was easy. We also started using this on our home stove and it is great. Highly recommend this cast iron griddle.
customer_reviews.author: Shell Burger

customer_reviews.title: use this every day
customer_reviews.text: I needed to season it once again after using it because things stuck to it but its pretty non stuck now and easy to clean. It now has so much flavor after 6 weeks of consistent use and I do not need to own another skillet. i though i would need egg molds or more accessories because of its size but all I use are two wooden spoons one is usually flat that can be used to scrape the surface.
customer_reviews.author: Aliella Mcalister

customer_reviews.title: Very versatile piece
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for camping trips but already used it on the stovetop. I like that it is versatile, a grill on one side and a griddle on the other. I also purchased the lodge accessory kit with spray on seasoning, plastic scraper and cleaning brush. It is harder to clean and care for at first but the more you use it the better it gets. It is heavy but that is to be expected
customer_reviews.author: Lori Reed

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I have always been a huge fan of Lodge's cast iron products. My food cooks evenly without sticking. Cooking pancakes on this griddle is a dream! Also, I used it as a pizza pan for my homemade pizza! I lightly oiled it. Then I preheated it in a 400 F degree oven. I took it out of the oven and sprinkled corn meal on it and placed the raw pizza dough on top and added all of my toppings. I had absolutely no problems with it sticking, and the pizza was fabulous!
customer_reviews.author: Winnenrosie

customer_reviews.title: A must have product
customer_reviews.text: We use this for pancakes, latkes, grilling veggies and more right on the stove top. Sometimes, this goes on camping trips for cooking over hot coals or on the grill. This is a must have item! This cast iron griddle comes pre-seasoned and it is easy to clean and maintain it's seasoned surface with olive oil. Remember that a well seasoned cast iron item should become non-stick eventually but these are not non-stick brand new. Use it often and re-season it often and before you know it, you can fry an egg that will slide right off the pan.
customer_reviews.author: Mommyx3Top Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Good Product that performs as expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my gas barbecue and It fits well on one half. I have only used it for ultra-thin burgers for quick cooking on a very high heat. It works well for this purpose and cleans fairly easily.
customer_reviews.author: B.L. Zeebub

customer_reviews.title: OK - Not Great
customer_reviews.text: It's heavy cast iron which has it's good points and bad points. Never had any food stick, but I'm very careful to correctly season cast iron. Generally use a griddle to do pancakes and bacon on a gas burner stove. Since cast iron doesn't have the heat conductivity of other metals I do have some issues with uneven cooking of both bacon and pancakes. The other issue is that there is no easy way to remove grease from the griddle and no grease storage groove on the sides. The sides are also quite short and you have to be careful when making pancakes that it doesn't run over.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sweet griddle
customer_reviews.text: Usual Lodge quality; holds heat well but is not heavier than a Buick like some griddles. Fits perfectly over two gas burners on my stovetop and also on top of 400-series Coleman camp stove (the main reason I bought it). I own the larger, heavier Lodge grill but will probably use this one more often because it's lighter and a lot easier to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Everett

customer_reviews.title: Great for grilling and outdoor cooking
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my fiancé for use on our grill. He’s a big fan of Lodge cast iron cookware. He did make bacon on our cooktop and I would not recommend for use indoors. Grease was everywhere and it took a few hours to cool before we could clean up. With that said, stick to using it for outdoor cooking
customer_reviews.author: Marilynn Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Portable and well made
customer_reviews.text: Like all cast iron, it cooks hot, so watch your flame. This things works great. Comes preseasoned but needs much more. Works great on my dual burner camp stove
customer_reviews.author: springer scott

customer_reviews.title: Received bent/bowed twice
customer_reviews.text: Very frustrated. I love lodge cast iron and have multiple pieces. I bought this griddle for my husband for his birthday and it was bowed, so I returned and got a replacement which is bent even more. Going to return for a refund at this point and I don't know what I'll buy instead. Super disappointing
customer_reviews.author: kaeldra1

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. I'm using it in my large Big Green Egg to make pizza mostly. Tonight we used it to fry/grill breaded chicken for chicken parmesan. Fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: descendent of Bill Wilson

customer_reviews.title: GREAT griddle! Perfect size. Why didn't I get one of these sooner?
customer_reviews.text: GREAT griddle! Perfect size. Why didn't I get one of these sooner? I love my Lodge skillet, and this griddle is an excellent new addition to my cast iron collection. I seasoned it 3 times prior to the first use, and guess what? Nothing stuck! I easily scraped it clean with the spatula and the oil from the food I cooked (grilled cheese sandwiches). Ignore the comments of people complaining about food sticking, rust, etc. Those folks CLEARLY DON'T KNOW HOW TO CARE FOR CAST IRON.
customer_reviews.author: MattH007

customer_reviews.title: Heavy and versatile
customer_reviews.text: Harder to clean but taking care of it as best I can. I have cooked bacon and eggs on the smooth side. And burgers and sausages in the rough side. It’s heavy. Research how to properly clean. Mine has got a few imperfections from use but food cooks well and it still has its seasoning.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Madigan

customer_reviews.title: Hard to dump grease.
customer_reviews.text: We like this for making bacon and burgers, but there is one really big drawback. On the "ribbed" side, the ribs run in the direction of the handles, which makes pouring the grease in to a jar for cleanup very difficult. You have to be an oven mitt ninja to get the grease to go in the jar without splashing it all over the edge. The other one we have has the ribs going the other way, and cleaning is a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: John Scott

customer_reviews.text: First use and clean and black seems to be literally coming off as you can see in the pictures. I am a consistent cast iron user and have never seen something like this. Highly disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Esteth

customer_reviews.title: Wow it will change how you grill
customer_reviews.text: Must have if you are a griller. The sear you can get on this without over cooking the meat can't be beat. And I love using some of the space to grill onions and peppers or other veggies. It is heavy and somewhat of a pain to carry into house for cleaning every time you use, but small price to pay for what it does.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and functionality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my new stove didn't come with the griddle plate and when I looked it up, it was much too expensive. This griddle by lodge was a fraction of the price and is of great quality. It is a little to wide for my oval burner but it distributes heat well so it doesn't matter. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly with induction cooktops
customer_reviews.text: Just the right size for two “burners “ on induction cooktop. Works perfectly on BOTH the flat and ridged sides. Easy to clean. Heats evenly. No hesitation in recommending it. It doesn’t have a handle and it’s heavy so just recognize that it’s a little awkward to move around.
customer_reviews.author: Occasionally Correct

customer_reviews.title: A great Lodge grill/griddle!
customer_reviews.text: We've used this regularly since it arrived & are delighted with it. We followed Lodge's instructions to the letter and never have a problem with sticking. After use, we simply clean it lightly with dish soap & a soft scrub sponge, dry it, then rub in a small amount of oil. Just a small amount of oil will work: a quarter-sized splash. It doesn't need to be gooey when you put it away. We really like our Lodge cookware. Personally, I think it must be Lodge's quality control. We've tried the cheap-o alternatives & they just don't compare.
customer_reviews.author: Howard A

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was hoping for.
customer_reviews.text: Could easily fit 6 full size patties on here. Probably 10 smaller patties. This is a game changer. I was worried it would be too small but it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb

customer_reviews.title: I love this griddle
customer_reviews.text: I have used it to make many Indian dishes like flatbread, dosa (which is like a crispy crepe-type pancake), toasted baguettes. It is a great tool that you can use for many purposes, and on the reverse side, I grilled some vegetables. Overall, I am very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why it took me so long to buy something like this. I love it. I've made pancakes on it a ton since I got it. I can fit 8 medium to small size pancakes on here which is perfect for me and my family. I highly recommend this! I've also done melts on here and I want to try to eggs on it.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Oil residue won't come off
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use as a pancake griddle. I was sick of my old nonstick griddle because the oil residue won't wash off. Because I love my cast iron pans I thought I would give this a try especially with the great reviews. Well after the first use I saw the same problem as my old nonstick griddle - the oil residue will NOT wash off - tried washing with soap/water and reheating on the stove but the sticky stuff won't budge. I don't think I'm doing anything wrong - no problems with my cast iron pans. So sadly I guess I'll be returning it and continue searching for a new griddle.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Indoor grilling finally
customer_reviews.text: An amazing option for those who live in apts and can’t grill. The heat distribution is a little suspect but I’m not 100% sure if it’s the griddle or the oven. Either way, it makes grilling steaks, chicken, and vegetables easy. The flat side is also great for breakfast. I’ve made pancakes, French toast, and eggs right on it. Cleaning off the grill side can be a pain but as long as you have a decent brush/sponge, you should be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: this rocks!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use in my gas grill. It comes pre ''seasoned," I just covered it in oil and let it heat up with the grill. Keeps the grill clean as well since there is no material dropping through the grates. Happy I made the decision to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: mark perez

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This griddle is just great! I had been looking for a reversabal griddle and this one is the perfect size for my gas stove and it also works great on the barbecue as well.
customer_reviews.author: Natalia nannini

customer_reviews.title: Gotta Be User Error
customer_reviews.text: I know it's user error, so please help me here. I've made pancakes 3 times now. The first 2 times the pancake browned nicely and released from the pan perfectly. After each use, I scrubbed the pan while still warm using only hot water and a scrub sponge with hot water. Now this third time the pancake over-browned and was seriously stuck to the pan. So what has changed? What am I doing wrong? Please email me at brigoertzen@sbcglobal.net Thanks for helping me out!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Goertzen

customer_reviews.title: fits large bge and lodge sportsman grill
customer_reviews.text: perfect fits: *big green egg (bge) Large *lodge sportsman grill looking forward to outdoor eggs & pancakes.. to avoid heating up the kitchen in the summer. it is heavy, and you have to know how to care for cast iron stuff.
customer_reviews.author: L. Caballes

customer_reviews.title: Hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: I really want to love this griddle but I am really in the fence. I don’t love having to clean it because of this I find myself not cooking anything messy. So basically it’s a tortilla warmer. Maybe not meant to be used on a glass top stove but it’s hard to get both halves heated to the same temp as well. I will update if I can figure out these issues.
customer_reviews.author: Elijah Engle

customer_reviews.title: Cast Iron is King
customer_reviews.text: Griddle fits nicely on top of two burners which allows for two distinctly different heat settings. Also food that needs less heat can be scooted off direct heat. Nice, nice cast iron griddle. So far just cooked on flat side so easily cleaned.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Walker

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Useful
customer_reviews.text: I hardly ever take the time to write a review but I have been VERY PLEASED with this item. So far I have used it on the stove top (griddle side) to make a ton of pancakes. I have also used it on the grill side in the oven to make BBQ chicken wings. Clean up was EASY. Hope this helps you decide.
customer_reviews.author: twinmama

customer_reviews.title: Great price and product.
customer_reviews.text: I’m so glad I finally caved and bought this. Been wanting one for the longest but the ones I’ve seen were so expensive. This grill is perfect for making smash burgers at home. And all other delicious things. I love Lodge Cast Iron products.
customer_reviews.author: SheiLae19

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Bought two to lay on top of my grill instead of paying for an entire flattop grill or flattop attachment. Works great and distributes heat perfectly. Good quality, great price!
customer_reviews.author: Evan Collins

customer_reviews.title: Great Griddle - Love the Double Sided Feature!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this griddle and love that it fits over two of my gas burners. I did use it on an open campfire and burnt off some of the seasoning however, that is user error - if doing that, raise it up from the flame if possible!
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat cast iron
customer_reviews.text: I only cook with cast iron, especially after learning that Teflon coated pans contain PFOS/PFOA. I love this griddle, my only wish is that it was a few inches longer to fit my stove better. It is still worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Neusiis

customer_reviews.title: Not very nice. I’ll clean and re-condition it
customer_reviews.text: I cook with lodge cast iron pans all the time, and I’m quite devoted to the material. I was looking forward to using this griddle on our new range. I still plan to, but it arrived today with clear signs of previous use, including burner marks on one side, and some caked on junk on the other. There was also a bit of rust around the edges. Not very nice. I’ll clean and re-condition it, but it’s an unpleasant surprise to order a new item and get a used one in this condition. No need to waste it, but they could have cleaned it up before reselling.
customer_reviews.author: Kput

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I ordered!
customer_reviews.text: I love this griddle!! I cant tell you how many cast aluminum griddles I had to go through before I finally caved into getting an actual cast iron ( I always felt that they were too heavy for my little old stove). It the perfect size for two vertical burners and really great for breakfast making and large quesadillas.
customer_reviews.author: Rosalie H

customer_reviews.title: I think I’m a master chef lol
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this grilled. I read the reviews and i see how people are complaining of the rust. You have to clean it right after use. Dry it and oil it (season it) if necessary just like any cast iron.
customer_reviews.author: Dee P

customer_reviews.title: Not good for a pound of bacon
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. Hears evenly. Works great in a gas stove. I have one issue though. It’s really hard to use the large surface to cook a package of bacon. The grease in the bacon fills the pan and it is dangerous to move the pan while it is still hot. Adding bacon tends to over flow the edges with grease and create minor flare ups.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: I love my griddle!
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have for a gas range and/or large grill. I have cooked every thing from breakfast to Mongolian grill on this bad boy. Picture perfect grilled cheese, pork chops, or grilled veggies. You won't be disappointed. Recommend getting the Lodge grill presses with your purchase of this griddle. Griddle comes pre-seasoned and gets better with age. NOTES: Use low heat as this heats fast and multiples applied heat. Level stove required as well as burner grates. Check level prior to use. Nice steel, square spatula recommended, get two as one may be needed to hold griddle down with minor sticking. Really good cooking gloves are highly recommended as well.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholeknc

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, Wonderful Cast Iron Griddle/Grill - Smaller to Fit on Glass Ceramic Cooktops
customer_reviews.text: This is a Heavy, Wonderful Cast Iron Griddle/Grill - Smaller to Fit on Glass Ceramic Cooktops. I had another one but have a new stovetop that gives errors with the larger old item I used to use. This is the perfect size and frankly, is more solid that the old griddle/grill I used to use AND easier to clean. Lodge makes terrific products!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Detail

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 2nd use
customer_reviews.text: Had a crack split down the edge while using on an electric stove. I would recommend heating the skillet as evenly as possible and perhaps ramping up the heat slowly if the heat is not even. Other then the crack, I enjoyed cooking on it alot.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Great grilling results; needs time consuming care
customer_reviews.text: Heavy cast iron is great for grilling sausages and other meat. Cleaning it and having to re-season it occasionally is a chore. 9.5 inch width is too narrow. Food falls off the edge. Would be much better if it is 12 inches wide. Use it less often now after purchasing a much wider Ceramic coated Aluminum Griddle. Some meats cook better on cast iron.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor T.

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Very happy so far. I love that I can cook a whole bunch of pancakes or burgers at once. I love that it is naturally non-stick and I don't have to worry about a chemical coating releasing into our food. Yes it is heavy, that is to be expected. And yes I am more adamant about telling my kids to stay out of the kitchen so no hands get near it, but they should stay away from the stove at this age anyway. I am used to hand washing my best work-horse pan so that is no problem.
customer_reviews.author: verdemom

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: I love this griddle. Besides the Lodge combo cooker, this is the most used piece of cast iron I own. I keep it on the stove. I never put it away. I have used both sides of this grill/griddle. I have so far used it to bake cookies, oven cook chicken wings at 500 degrees, grill turkey burgers, and sauté squash and zucchini. It's a little hard to clean the grill side, so I will have to buy a specific tool for that. I like that I can get my cooking and weight lifting in at the same time (LOL! this thing is heavy for sure!).
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Great kitchen tool
customer_reviews.text: This is just the cooking tool I needed for making pancakes. When I got it a scrubbed it a little bit with a plastic brush in hot water. Dryed it. Put a thin coat of vegetable oil on it and cooked it for 1 hour @450 F. I did that 2 times. Cooked pancakes and bacon on it so far. Very nice tool! I am going to add another 2 more seasonings, just to make sure it get's a nice coating. I am going to try a deep sided 12 inch for frying chicken.
customer_reviews.author: barry916

customer_reviews.title: Does what I ask
customer_reviews.text: Like most of the reviews here, this combo grill / griddle does everything I ask of it. Stove Top, Gas Grill, Camp Stove. I like to season my cast iron even though it comes with Lodge's seasoning. Although, out of the box, pancakes and eggs didn't stick with a small amount of grease added to coat the griddle. In other words, food wasn't floating in grease. Used primarily for camping, the dimensions work well for the camp kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Robert G

customer_reviews.title: No grease containment for meat grilling
customer_reviews.text: Seasoning process & quality is great as I’ve always used Lodge. However, this really needs a much deeper lip around the frame or a grease containment unit under it. With the very low lip of the frame and no way to contain grease, trying to cook meat is not worth the challenge.
customer_reviews.author: Mandi Eudy

customer_reviews.title: So much better than flimsy pans for pancakes/grilled cheese
customer_reviews.text: I can’t stand warping cheap, flimsy pans (which inevitably happens) when making pancakes/grilled cheese. And I hate the idea of eating Teflon and other coatings. This is such a superior solution and ... it’s still inexpensive. I got two, and I tend to leave one sitting across two burners a lot of the time. But they do store easily tilted up on edge in a cabinet without taking up much space at all.
customer_reviews.author: Andruvius

customer_reviews.title: I'm hoping with more use it will get better.
customer_reviews.text: Product is a little disappointing. I have not been able to "season" it. Food still sticking to the griddle. I'm hoping with more use it will get better. 9/19/18, I have been using the griddle for two years now. For the past six months the black top has been pealing off. I contacted Amazon, nothing they can do, suggested I purchase a new one. I thought I'd get more then two years use from it. Has anyone else had this problem?
customer_reviews.author: john m digeronimo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for camping
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a family camping trip. I used this with the coleman stovetop and it worked perfectly. The pan came pre-seasoned but make sure you season it again after the first use for longevity.
customer_reviews.author: BostonGators

customer_reviews.title: Great Cast Iron
customer_reviews.text: I am a fan of cast iron and this Lodge did not disappoint. Like the two sided - smooth side for pancakes, etc. and the other side for burgers, steak, chops, etc. Cleaning as with most cast iron is good. Pan the grill / griddle comes seasoned. But, you still need to continue to season just like w/all cast iron. And purchased it on sale so even better! All around if you are interested in purchasing this item you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: How to use that weird oval burner on your new stove.
customer_reviews.text: We just got a new gas cooktop with an elongated center burner, and I was wondering what the heck I would ever put on it. This answers that question. It fits the length/width profile of the burner and flame perfectly. Heat distribution is relatively even, although the extreme edges of the grid side are slightly cooler and require moving sausages/bacon around. I've put four packages of six breakfast sausages on here without problem. For sausages, I also use the Lodge LGP3 Grill Press. On the smooth size, we've done a huge load of pancakes without moving them around at all. What's really great is that it takes the "shiftwork" out of making breakfast. Typical Lodge high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Randy King

customer_reviews.title: Love by Lodge Griddle
customer_reviews.text: I love all my Lodge cast iron products. I have several skillets as well as the meat press. This griddle is excellent. Keep the heat low and preheat slowly. Nothing sticks to it and pancakes are amazing. I haven't cooked with it outside yet, but cannot wait. Another winner from Lodge. AMERICAN MADE!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Coudray

customer_reviews.title: Fun cooking tool but hard to clean!
customer_reviews.text: My first griddle and its definitely a learning process. Cooking steak on it will set off your smoke detector unless you got a good vent to suck in all the smoke. Tried cooking on both side and it was okay. Really hard to clean though, especially if you cook steak on it.
customer_reviews.author: T Worline

customer_reviews.title: Fits great on the coleman camp stove and doesn't warp
customer_reviews.text: Yeah, it's heavy. You don't want to carry this in your backpack - but if you're looking for a robust cast iron griddle that won't warp, is easy to clean, and will last for years, this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Horvick

customer_reviews.title: Great for pancakes!
customer_reviews.text: Update: this lives on my cooktop full time, except when it’s grill side up cooking bacon in the stove. We use it for just about everything, and its almost completely non-stick due to constant use (I keep a jar of coconut oil just for wiping it down after every use). Be sure to keep it seasoned, like any cast iron, but it's fairly non stick and we use it on the stove or in the oven quite a lot, from pancakes to grilled asparagus it's terrific.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Good price griddle
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my gas stove in the house. It will heat up over whatever burner you put it on. You could create hot and warm spots. The problem is that it doesn’t come with any handles to remove move the griddle.
customer_reviews.author: Clinton L. Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Do your own seasoning before taking it camping.
customer_reviews.text: I'm thinking the more expensive one is probably a better design. This is very difficult to pick up when it is hot. There are no handles. Would probably be okay for a grill or stove top where you could let it sit and pick up later. Also definitely season this before you take it camping. I was left with a sticky mess to clean up at the campsite after trying to make bacon and pancakes on it.
customer_reviews.author: Dodgson_here

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't lay flat, otherwise I love it
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I have not given it 5 stars is because it does not lay flat on my stove top, Not only annoying, but makes it less stable, slides around on my glass induction top when I am using the spatula on it requiring me to hold the edge with an oven mitt...
customer_reviews.author: Loki

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality, Hard to Use
customer_reviews.text: I've used it only once, to make pancakes. They stuck so badly I had a really hard time even scraping them off once soaked -- in fact, there is still some remnants of food left. Perhaps I didn't "season" it enough. I thought it came ready to use. And perhaps I should have cooked something more greasy on it first (I read that somewhere). I don't want to use brillo on it... It's obviously very high quality, so I'm sure I'm making the mistake here.
customer_reviews.author: CR-Berkeley

customer_reviews.title: Grill/Griddle
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice heavy-duty cast iron grill/griddle. I have a gas stove and I leave this over the middle burner all the time. It is easy to keep clean and fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Munger

customer_reviews.title: Rusty
customer_reviews.text: Rusted after one use. Used it to grill some steak. Sprayed it with a dishwashing liquid and water combination and left it overnight. The next morning it was completely rusted.
customer_reviews.author: KeshaK

product_meta.title: Lodge Pre-Seasoned Cast Iron Reversible Grill/Griddle, 16.75 Inch x 9.5 Inch, Black

Package Quantity:1| Color:BlackWhat could be better than a reversible griddle? The smooth side is great for making grilled cheese sandwiches as well as eggs and pancakes The ribbed side is perfect for grilling foods such as steak, fish, chicken and hamburgers.
